item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
With the advent of luxury sports cars, luxury sport watches, even luxury sport equipment, why not a luxury sport hotel? The Crans Ambassador Luxury Sport Resort is the first destination of it’s kind offering the freedom of sport, the luxury of kindness and a truly magical location.
A perfect differentiator for a 50 million CHF renovation, based high in the Valais Alps. An idyllic destination of world-class skiing, home of the European Golf Open, countless mountain sports and even the finish line of the Tour de Suisse.
Because of these three tiers of the brand, not just the communication but all aspects of the hotel from interior design to service, cuisine, programs and amenities reflected an upscale, sportive and imaginative quality.
From playful figures that appeared as subtle icons throughout the hotel instead of the typical emblazed logos– to the mixing of a modern mountain style with comforts and inspiring nature. Everything was approached new.
Rooms that adapt to the user, not the other way around. An elaborate sports spa, with rotating doctors, specialists and trainers. An in-house presentation theatre and a creative “Think Tank” versus classic conferencing. Year-round Sport Academies. A Boys Toys Club featuring Ferrari paraphernalia, Davidoff cigars and Hublot Watches. Even a three-star Michelin chef from Paris balanced with a naturopath chef and nutrition show kitchen.
Sport and luxury are designed as the red thread to run through all aspects of the guest experience.

item.title: creating a new kind of hotel
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: With the advent of luxury sports cars, luxury sport watches, even luxury sport equipment, why not a luxury sport hotel? The Crans Ambassador Luxury Sport Resort is the first destination of it’s kind offering the freedom of sport, the luxury of kindness and a truly magical location. A perfect differentiator for a 50 million CHF renovation, based high in the Valais Alps.  An idyllic destination of world-class skiing, home of the European Golf Open, countless mountain sports and even the finish line of the Tour de Suisse. Because of these three tiers of the brand, not just the communication but all aspects of the hotel from interior design to service, cuisine, programs and amenities reflected an upscale, sportive and imaginative quality. From playful figures that appeared as subtle icons throughout the hotel instead of the typical emblazed logos-- to the mixing of a modern mountain style with comforts and inspiring nature.  Everything was approached new. Rooms that adapt to the user, not the other way around.  An elaborate sports spa, with rotating doctors, specialists and trainers. An in-house presentation theatre and a creative “Think Tank” versus classic conferencing. Year-round Sport Academies. A Boys Toys Club featuring Ferrari paraphernalia, Davidoff cigars and Hublot Watches.  Even a three-star Michelin chef from Paris balanced with a naturopath chef and nutrition show kitchen. Sport and luxury are designed as the red thread to run through all aspects of the guest experience.

item.title: cv
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Christopher J Masterson

Creative Director / Strategic / Branding

www.christophermasterson.net

Professional Background

Jan 2009-Feb 2011 Dir. Branding & Communications Normaah Ambassador Holding, (Hotel Group) Switzerland.
  • Responsible for project vision, strategic branding and all communications for the new Crans Ambassador Luxury Sport Resort, Valais Alps, Switzerland.
  • Creating a new segment in the hospitality industry.
  • Implementation of concept through collaboration with architects and designers. guiding operations, marketing and advertising ensuring a red line throughout the entire guest experience.
2003-2008 Global Creative Director, Nokia, Grey Worldwide, London Nokia Mobile Phones
  • Creative strategies and implementation for over-all core branding. Helping Nokia to find and define its soul globally.
  • Creative supervision across network agencies in all key markets.
  • Created new brand division and categorization into E-Series (work), N-Series, (interactive) Live (fashion and premium) and Connect (emerging markets and mainstream simplicity products.)
  • Headed new brand visualization guidelines. New photography & layout style.
  • Implemented global launch campaigns for all divisions of mobile phones.
  • Insight into emerging markets and other target markets.
2000-2003 Board of Directors, International Creative Director Bates International. Barcelona /Frankfurt SEAT Automobiles VW.
  • Build a new brand through all com platforms for SEAT Automobiles based in Spain.
  • Develop and define within existing VW’s brand portfolio of Audi, Skoda, Lamborgini and Volkswagen.
  • Build and manage an office in Barcelona to facilitate client and base the international account.
  • Creative Director and Co-Managing Director.
  • All European branding and international new model launches, & production supervision.
2000 Creative Consultant, Alireza D’Arcy, Jeddah
  • Agency restructure & build creative & planning departments.
  • Conduct client workshops, training, evaluate expectations, revamp production process.
  • Won new accounts,: VW Audi/Porsche of Saudi Arabia, Agrisouk beverages.
1998-2000 Executive Creative Director Dr. Puttner Bates, Austria
  • Agency restructure & build creative department. Overhaul production procedures.
  • Creative supervision Mercedes Austria, Priority Telecom, Canon Europe, VISA Card
1998-1999 Adjunct Professor Webster University, Vienna
  • Conduct MBA Marketing seminars.
  • Organize and teach International Marketing, Advertising & Campaigns curriculum.
  • Run creative campaign courses in conjunction with current high-profile clients.
1996-1998 Co-Creative Director Bates, Singapore
  • Creative establishment of the Nokia brand in APAC. Image, new product launches, implementation.
  • Creative development for Heineken, Discovery Channel, Fujitsu
1995-1996 Associate Creative Director M&C Saatchi, Singapore
  • Creative development for BMW Asia, Bank of China, British Airways BTL
1994 Group Head Tracy Locke, Dallas
  • Creative supervision for GTE Voice Products, Pepsi Co. Tabasco Brand
1993 Creative Freelance BMB&B, St. Louis
  • Creative reinvention for packaged goods. (Food snack & beverages)
1992 Creative Freelance Soderberg & Associates, Seattle.
  • Copywriter, conceptualizer for fashion brands. Luccesse, Union Bay Jeans, Snow Boarder, Bad Boy, Avia shoes.
1988-1992 Copywriter, DDB Seattle
  • Creative responsibilities Holland America Cruise Line, Westours/GrayLine Alaska, McDonalds, Nordstrom, West One Bank, Jansport, Big Brothers of America

Educational Background

1987 School of Visual Concepts, Seattle 1986 Masters Degree, Cultural Anthropology, U of W, Research published 1987 1985 Bachelor of Arts, Communications, University of Washington, Seattle 1983 Proto-Polynesian studies, University of Hawaii, Manoa 1982 Associate of Arts, Columbia Basin College, Washington

Associations

Board of Directors, Sonrisas de Bombay. A highly successful non-profit organization based in Barcelona/NYC focused on education, adoption and removing children from the prostitutions rings of Mumbai, India. Mountain Search and Rescue Climbing Ranger and Mountain Medic for the National Park Service, USA National Ski Instructors Association, USA Swiss Ski School & Guide. Royal Yachting Association, Professional Skipper.

Recognition & Awards

Guest Speaker, Global Communications, Christ Church College, Oxford; Guest Speaker, New Commerce of Eastern Europe, Ukraine & Baltic; Creative Council, Bates Worldwide Creative Council, Nokia Advertising of the Year, Asia Pacific: Nokia NW Addy: McDonald’s, Holland America Cruises Halo Award: Big Brothers of America Soundy: Nordstrom, Jansport CCA Best International TVC: Nokia Cannes, Gold Lion, Best Cinema: SEAT Automobiles Mobile: +41 793593862 c.masterson@mac.com

Educational Background 1987 School of Visual Concepts, Seattle 1986 Masters Degree, Cultural Anthropology, U of W, Research published 1987 1985 Bachelor of Arts, Communications, University of Washington, Seattle 1983 Proto-Polynesian studies, University of Hawaii, Manoa 1982 Associate of Arts, Columbia Basin College, Washington Associations Board of Directors, Sonrisas de Bombay. A highly successful non-profit organization based in Barcelona/NYC focused on education, adoption and removing children from the prostitutions rings of Mumbai, India.
Mountain Search and Rescue Climbing Ranger and Mountain Medic for the National Park Service, USA National Ski Instructors Association, USA Swiss Ski School & Guide. Royal Yachting Association, Professional Skipper. Recognition & Awards Guest Speaker, Global Communications, Christ Church College, Oxford; Guest Speaker, New Commerce of Eastern Europe, Ukraine & Baltic; Creative Council, Bates Worldwide Creative Council, Nokia
Advertising of the Year, Asia Pacific: Nokia NW Addy: McDonald’s, Holland America Cruises Halo Award: Big Brothers of America Soundy: Nordstrom, Jansport CCA Best International TVC: Nokia Cannes, Gold Lion, Best Cinema: SEAT Automobiles

item.content:encoded: Slideshow of words

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
A small example of work for cars, clothes and communication.
Video
A sample selection from across the site:
Thumbs

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
‘What Connects Us?’ To democratize Nokia’s new Connect Category, the human technology that attracts us to the product is matched with what links us with each other in “It’s what connects us.”
[images] Slider Series Each phone with its own USP, price point and niche to fill, yet all featured a sliding top plate design. Movement became the theme. For youth– affordable, small, simple because “there’s a lot behind a little move.”
[video]
The more elegant, high-end phone reflected how “refinement moves differently.”
[video]
And, the new video phone, launched 3G to a mainstream target, turning “a movement into a memorable moment.”
[video]
[video] Nokia Listen Nokia had earned a reputation for getting people to talk, what about getting people to listen? Our APAC launch for music phones targeted to youths. The root of most societal problems and respect, this insight said “we understand” helping Nokia to gain credibility in a “me too” offering.
[image] Convergence All-in-one is a common brief by mobile phone clients. Rather than tout what the phone has in it, we focus on its ability to keep you connected to music, memories, maps, or even each other, no matter where you are.
[images] New materials While competitors would boast the feature of steel, Nokia beats them with the benefit of feel.
[video]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Luchesse Lucchese built a reputation with custom-made boots for notable figures from President Roosevelt to John Wayne– they branched out into Western clothing by building on to this quality story.
[images] Discovery Channel “It’s like being there” was created to help break Discovery Channel away from the docu-dull stereotype. Explore your world through in-home, insightful entertainment. It propelled them to number one in Asia in the Learning / Documentary category.
[images] Heineken Despite industry pressure, Heineken has never changed its recipe. Part of a two-year campaign of cases where successful people never compromised their values. It also elevated Heineken amongst an image-driven Asian market. Here we see a man who was taught by his industrialist Grandfather to be “True to Yourself” and never, ever, play in the factory.
[video] US Bank Humor is human. In attempts to position the new US Bank (which grew out of a hostile take over of smaller community banks) as a more friendly, human bank, a campaign based on the cartoons of Gerry VanAmarandon.
[images] Fujitsu Japanese computer quality now available in the greater Asian market by underlining of their cultural drive for perfection. EG: “A thousand cranes is not about the sheer number, but how meticulous each one.”
[images] Hugo Boss One of three slightly defiant films to run in the opening Hugo Boss stores in Vienna, positioning the Boss brand as more edgy and young than traditional Hugo. “Style makes the man” “You are what you wear” and this thought by Marlene Dietrich…
[video]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
With VW’s ‘Everybody’s automobile,’ Audi’s ‘Obtainable precision,’ Skoda’s ‘Value for money”, and the aspiration of Lamborgini, where does SEAT sit? This campaign launched it’s new flagship model and rooted an imaginative, colorful brand in to a world of “Power and Passion.” From showroom design to service floor mats, this avant-garde style was integrated throughout.
[video]
Follow up was done in the same style, reflecting Design, Technology and Attitutde, yet highlighting specific features.
[video]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Nokia needed to introduce a very basic phone for emerging and mainstream markets desiring simplicity. The back brief was to not focus on the design of the phone as the brand was a late entry into the North American flip category.

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The launch of a “human technology” campaign capable of being easily translated into all cultures of the Austral-Asia market was to be Nokia’s point of difference. Despite Asia’s infatuation with cool, cold, futuristic tech, the entire premise of the brand in the East was built on technology that thinks and feels like you do.
[video]
Second stage was to enforce brand benefits not features.
[video]
Initial corporate layout included the circle of observation and object of answer. For example, below, “Sometimes a lot depends on one finger.” Answer: “That’s why we made one-touch dialing.” We call this human technology. Click below for more examples.
[image]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
So successful was the Idefix (basic phone, black line on white) campaign, Nokia developed an evolution of the product with slightly more sophistication and color; with a fully integrated campaign to follow suit.
[video]
In order to gain launch support of markets, a preview of the entire campaign from product schematics and creative to event marketing is circulated in advance. View integrated campaign here.
[link to campaign .ppt] Building support A CD of all creative elements is supplied for adaptation plus an additional “Making Of” to create a feeling of ownership and enthusiasm amongst regions.
[video]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
In Europe, as the product portfolio blossomed the brand needed to step back and regain it’s clean, bright, and friendly feel. It is technology and design that thinks like you.
[global proposal .ppt]
With the adoption of the new visual guidelines and globalization, products became secondary to an emotional pay off. “What makes you connect” stretched past phone features and into personal passions.
[images]

item.title: nokia's new look
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Leading an experimental global shoot to steer Nokia into a cohesive direction with the talents of photographer Alan Kaplan, we set out to capture the intimacy, insight and honesty of the brand. This led to a simple “learnings” document to be adopted by all vendors, agencies, and in-house art directors working on the brand. Next, a follow-up shoot to build a new Nokia photo bank. Examples below.
Click here to view the Perpetual Photo brief to guide agencies worldwide.
[brief .ppt]
[images]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Shaping a new company’s direction, this was created for in-house, partners, dealers and coms. It builds the brand on three pillars of Design, Technology and Attitude.

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Compiled as a reminder of the history Bates, Grey and Nokia shared, plus the intricate world-wide workings servicing the brand, this represents about 15 years of work. It shows how, together, we built the fifth brand of the world.
[video]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
With a company consolidation of image and advertising and a need to get back to what orginally built a brand between Mercedes and Benz, this shows how “Appreciation” is a multi-faceted and two-way premise.
[video]
This 3-meter presentation tool was built in person ring by radiating ring to show how “Appreciation” can be a truly global premise. Beginning with the root interpretation per region, the targeted focal points, continuing out through integrated marketing ideas.
[image]

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hi, this is a comment.
To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickies to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

With VW's 'Everybody's automobile,' Audi's 'Obtainable precision,' Skoda's 'Value for money'', and the aspiration of Lamborgini, where does SEAT sit? This campaign launched it's new flagship model and rooted an imaginative, colorful brand in to a world of "Power and Passion." From showroom design to service floor mats, this avant-garde style was integrated throughout.

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
In Europe, as the product portfolio blossomed the brand needed to step back and regain it's clean, bright, and friendly feel. It is technology and design that thinks like you.
[global proposal .ppt]
With the adoption of the new visual guidelines and globalization, products became secondary to an emotional pay off. "What makes you connect" stretched past phone features and into personal passions.

item.title: image campaigns
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Luchesse

Lucchese built a reputation with custom-made boots for notable figures from President Roosevelt to John Wayne-- they branched out into Western clothing by building on to this quality story. [images]

Discovery Channel

"It's like being there" was created to help break Discovery Channel away from the docu-dull stereotype. Explore your world through in-home, insightful entertainment. It propelled them to number one in Asia in the Learning / Documentary category. [images]

Heineken

Despite industry pressure, Heineken has never changed its recipe. Part of a two-year campaign of cases where successful people never compromised their values. It also elevated Heineken amongst an image-driven Asian market. Here we see a man who was taught by his industrialist Grandfather to be "True to Yourself" and never, ever, play in the factory. [video]

US Bank

Humor is human. In attempts to position the new US Bank (which grew out of a hostile take over of smaller community banks) as a more friendly, human bank, a campaign based on the cartoons of Gerry VanAmarandon. [images]

Fujitsu

Japanese computer quality now available in the greater Asian market by underlining of their cultural drive for perfection. EG: "A thousand cranes is not about the sheer number, but how meticulous each one." [images]

Hugo Boss

One of three slightly defiant films to run in the opening Hugo Boss stores in Vienna, positioning the Boss brand as more edgy and young than traditional Hugo. "Style makes the man" "You are what you wear" and this thought by Marlene Dietrich... [video]

item.title: launch campaigns
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
'What Connects Us?'

To democratize Nokia's new Connect Category, the human technology that attracts us to the product is matched with what links us with each other in "It's what connects us." [images]

Slider Series

Each phone with its own USP, price point and niche to fill, yet all featured a sliding top plate design. Movement became the theme. For youth-- affordable, small, simple because "there's a lot behind a little move." [video] The more elegant, high-end phone reflected how "refinement moves differently." [video] And, the new video phone, launched 3G to a mainstream target, turning "a movement into a memorable moment." [video] [video]

Nokia Listen

Nokia had earned a reputation for getting people to talk, what about getting people to listen? Our APAC launch for music phones targeted to youths. The root of most societal problems and respect, this insight said "we understand" helping Nokia to gain credibility in a "me too" offering. [image]

Convergence

All-in-one is a common brief by mobile phone clients. Rather than tout what the phone has in it, we focus on its ability to keep you connected to music, memories, maps, or even each other, no matter where you are. [images]

New materials

While competitors would boast the feature of steel, Nokia beats them with the benefit of feel. [video]

item.title: integrated campaign

So successful was the Idefix (basic phone, black line on white) campaign, Nokia developed an evolution of the product with slightly more sophistication and color; with a fully integrated campaign to follow suit. [video] In order to gain launch support of markets, a preview of the entire campaign from product schematics and creative to event marketing is circulated in advance. View integrated campaign here. [link to campaign .ppt]

Building support

A CD of all creative elements is supplied for adaptation plus an additional "Making Of" to create a feeling of ownership and enthusiasm amongst regions. [video]
